com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.ButtonVariants

Class HybridSettingsButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.ButtonVariants.HybridSettingsButton
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HybridBooleanSelectButton, HybridFileSelectButton, HybridMultiSelectButton, HybridTargetActivatorButton

    public abstract class HybridSettingsButton
extends java.lang.Object
    Determines settings, behavior, and handling for a linked hybrid settings button (instances of the XML layout hybrid_settings_button). Abstract, cannot be instantiated. Use a subclass of this instead, or create one yourself.

    • Method Detail

      • getLinkedView

        public android.widget.RelativeLayout getLinkedView()
        Gets the Hybrid Button XML element that this object is currently linked to.
        Returns:
        the View that this object is linked to

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets this button's description.
        Returns:
        the text currently displayed by this button

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String desc)
        Sets the display text for this button object. Does not update the linked view until the updateLinkedView() method is called.
        Parameters:
        desc - the text to display on the button. Providing a null reference will default to the state provided by the Context that was given as an argument to this object's constructor.

      • getIcon

        public android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getIcon()
        Gets this button's icon.
        Returns:
        the Drawable that this object is currently displaying as its icon

      • setIcon

        public void setIcon(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable icon)
        Sets the icon for this button object. Does not update the linked view until the updateLinkedView() method is called.
        Parameters:
        icon - the Drawable to set this button's icon to. Providing a null reference will default to the state provided by the Context that was given as an argument to this object's constructor.

      • updateLinkedView

        public void updateLinkedView()
        Updates this object's linked View object with this object's current icon and description.

      • getSettingID

        public java.lang.String getSettingID()
        Gets the currently used setting ID for communications with a SettingsManager object.
        Returns:
        the current setting ID

      • handleInteract

        public abstract void handleInteract(SettingsManager manager)
        Handles user interaction for this button type. Implementation is specific to the button subtype implementing this method.
        Parameters:
        manager - the SettingsManager object to push the updated state to. If null, this object will skip pushing the new state and simply update its internal value.
        See Also:
        handleInteract()

      • loadDefaultState

        public abstract void loadDefaultState(SettingsManager manager)
        Resets this button to its default state. The default state may be specified manually with the setDefault method (implemented by subclasses). This only loads default settings for the stored data state of the object, and not its appearance.
        Parameters:
        manager - the SettingsManager object to push the updated state to. If null, this object will skip pushing the new state and simply update its internal value.
        See Also:
        loadDefaultState()

      • handleInteract

        public void handleInteract()
        Handles user interaction for this button type. Implementation is specific to the button subtype implementing this method. The default implementation of this method chains to handleInteract(SettingsManager) with the SettingsManager instance provided by SettingsManagerDelegator.getMainInstance(). All other behavior is the same.
        See Also:
        handleInteract(SettingsManager)

      • loadDefaultState

        public void loadDefaultState()
        Resets this button to its default state. The default state may be specified manually with the setDefault method (implemented by subclasses). This only loads default settings for the stored data state of the object, and not its appearance. The default implementation of this method chains to loadDefaultState(SettingsManager) with the SettingsManager instance provided by SettingsManagerDelegator.getMainInstance(). All other behavior is the same.
        See Also:
        loadDefaultState(SettingsManager)
